thread.title: Angel Lebon Brings The First Modern Immigrant Romantic Comedy “A Foreign Exchange Love” to Hollywood
thread.title_full: Angel Lebon Brings The First Modern Immigrant Romantic Comedy “A Foreign Exchange Love” to Hollywood

author: prbuzz.com
title: Angel Lebon Brings The First Modern Immigrant Romantic Comedy “A Foreign Exchange Love” to Hollywood
text:
Hollywood, CA – Executive Producer Angel Lebon and Lead Actress Sara Sometti Michaels will be hosting a one-time screening of the film “A Foreign Exchange Love” based on “A Foreign exchange Love” a comedy web series in the vein of “Sex and the City” and “2 Broke Girls” at The Working Stage Theater on November 5th at 9pm.
The story centers on Erica Marini, a nice girl from Italy who came to Los Angeles to find the man of her dreams. Upon arrival, she meets Kayla Roberts her slutty European roommate with a humorous opinion on how the male mind works. With Kayla’s misguided advice, Erica continues to look for love in all the wrong places until she meets a nice Italian man and decides that maybe men from back home weren’t so bad after all.
“A Foreign Exchange Love” is for the 25-35 year old young women who love LA and are pop culture enthusiasts. The gorgeous men romantic and dramatic edge will also appeal to most women.
Tickets for the screening are completely sold out but view the web series starting Nov 5th at: http://www.aforeignexchangelove.com
Proceeds from the screening benefit Susan G. Komen for the Cure, a non-profit organization dedicated to saving lives and ending breast cancer forever.
“In some ways, every child dreams of growing up and finding that special someone to love and call their own.”, said Director and Executive Producer Angel Lebon. Upon hearing that, Sara Sometti Michaels chuckles, “Most girls start out like Erica, looking for a man to complete them. But they grow up and realize that they don’t need anyone to complete them because their own happiness was inside them the whole time.”
About Angel Lebon
Angel Lebon is an award winning Director and Producer who fell in love with film at the age of three when he saw Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi on the big screen, and he has been making films ever since.
Originally from Guam, USA, he now spends his time in Los Angeles and San Francisco, while developing his next feature film for Sundance.
About Sara Sometti Michaels
Sara Sometti Michaels is an Actress and writer who is a recent winner of Scriptd “One Minute Horror competition” for her story “The Doll Maker”.
